Reviews.Title: “Lokks much nicer on pictures”
Reviews.Author: gea-bud
Reviews.Content: the area is a bit run down, not the best part of town to have a night walk though it is very close to la rambla and by underground everything is easily accessible. very weird place with the black walls but i had a feeling the whole dark design was to cover cheap materials. having no window is not the best idea for claustrophoby. other than that the room is ok, the bed was comfy and what else do you need if you visit barcelona? you shouldn't waste your time in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Red light district ?”
Reviews.Author: Cheerio9
Reviews.Content: Unsure if I was window shopping or finding our room with the red lights throughout the hotel. But room was ok and the location was excellent. Take an eye mask if you do stay here as the lights from outside the hotel are on very bright and all night

Reviews.Title: “Good value very close to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Wynn07
Reviews.Content: We booked Acta Mimic because it was the cheapest central hotel we could find. The hotel is situated on a back street with hardly any traffic so noise is minimal. Yes it can seem a little seedy but we had no problems and did not feel threatened. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, and spoke some English. The only thing we didn't like were the black corridors with red lights which led to the rooms. Just a little off putting. The rooms however were mostly white (black ceilings) and were spotlessly clean. Not a lot of storage but enough for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: SandDCroatia
Reviews.Content: Been in Barcelona for a weekend in March, stayed at Acta Mimic hotel. The location is perfect, you have a walking distance to La Rambla, and many interesting places to visit. The hotel is clean, quiet, and has a modern interior, a very nice lobby too. The only thing that surprised me is that there were no windows in the room...but this is a minor lack. This was my first visit to Barcelona and I absolutely loved it !!!! Planning to go back for a few more days :)

Reviews.Title: “Am I in a hotel or backstreet hospital”
Reviews.Author: RPMol
Reviews.Content: Officially and unfortunately, the worst place I have ever stayed in Barcelona. Situated in an dark and backstreet alley with no shops or activity around, the hotel entrance looks more like the entrance to a housing estate. I have a room on the first floor and the corridor is lit by red lights shining on the room numbers. I feel like I'm renting by the hour! The room smell of disinfectant, the type used in hospitals and to compliment that feeling the floor is plastic white, a curtain separates the bathroom from the sleeping area and the massive window in the bathroom looks out onto the back of very shabby housing. Although you can cover most of the Window with a curtain there is a circular cut out in the shaded glass right in the shower area. I'm sure as a woman you'd be very happy taking a shower knowing shanty town is looking right at you! There is no desk or Internet so business travelers stay well away. In fact I would not recommend this place at all. I seem to be unique in my view considering the other reviews but as a weekly business traveler this is not a place I'd ever want to stay in again. I'm shortening my stay to 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Not the prettiest - but has all you need!”
Reviews.Author: mallonmaria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is from the outside a little off putting to say the least. Its down a dodgy street so dont stay here if you are looking for a "view" from your window. It is by no means dirty or anything - actually spotless clean at all times. We found it quite modern which we loved as we are into that type of thing but could be a little "cold" if you dont like all that stuff. Be careful if you are not fond of stairs or are not very mobile as our room (Room 8) was a studio which had a VERY steep spiral staircase to get to the bedroom upstairs. On entering the room, you are straight into the bathroom area where there is a seperate glass door into the toilet and a glass panel (which is not frosted) into the wet room / shower which is not very private at all. The bedroom which was quite small was upstairs. We found it ok in size. We stayed for 3 nights, it may have felt a little clostraphobic if we had to stay much longer. I wouldnt recommend this hotel for families. It had a small dining area which was casual - ie.. not to use to sit down for a formal evening meal, but great for breakfast or luch or a snack during the day. We found this hotel quite charming - even though we stayed here in winter, so I can imagine it being twice as nice during summer as it has many areas within the bar/lounge which can be open air during those months. It also has a roof top terrace which opens in summer also which looked quite cool. We didnt have breakfast there so cant comment on food. It is in a good location - bout 5-10 mins walk to centre of Las Ramblas. A taxi from El Prat airport to the hotel cost us €35 euro so maybe using local transport may suit better if you want to save on that. If you are staying here in January / Feb 2012, please make sure you contact the hotel and ask if the "construction" is still in operating right outside - if so, make sure your room is not directly on this street as the noise of Kango's started daily at 9am. Its only work on the street outside so maybe only short term but we found it a pain in the butt. Also, no Wi-Fi for the entire time we were there - even though it was advertised everywhere. Overall, I would stay here again in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it despite a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: mmanuel75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, just off avenue Parallel. We didn’t find the part of the street the hotel is on is particularly seedy. However we go to Barcelona often and are very used to the Raval area. Our first impressions of the hotel were not very good. We found that the room, on the fourth floor, was on the small side with barely enough room to walk around the bed and a badly designed wardrobe. Also, although the hotel is new the room doesn’t look very new anymore, with white marks on the toilet’s black walls, stains on the bathroom floor and rust at the base of the sink. However, the room was very clean and the bed comfortable. When we entered the room it was extremely hot and stuffy. The window does not open so I tried to switch on the air conditioning unit but it was blowing hot air instead of cold air even though it was on the cooling setting. Also the room safe didn’t work. The person at reception told me the air conditioning was turned off in winter because “at the moment it is 6c outside”. That day it was 17c ... He said he could change us room but that would probably make no difference because all the rooms were the same. I insisted we needed a functioning safe so he called the technician who came to our room right away to check it out and said he could fix it or replace it in the afternoon. When we got back to the room later that evening the safe was indeed fixed and the room felt much cooler and we had a good night sleep. The next morning we slept quite late and just after 12 received a phone call from reception to tell us we were supposed to leave the room by 12. I had to explain that I made a reservation for 4 nights so we were not leaving that day. 5 minutes later a lady knocked at our door to ask us again when we were leaving... we were not very impressed.... However, I have to say that despite a bad start we quickly warmed up to the hotel. We got used to the design of the room and absolutely loved the rain shower. The hotel has a nice solarium on the roof and a very nice breakfast/meeting room/ bar area. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but went to the bar one evening and really enjoyed it. Also, the hotel location was perfect for us. We will definitely go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden hotel in the city centre!”
Reviews.Author: JannyC1980
Reviews.Content: Very good location in the city centre- one street away from La Rambla and 2 min walk to Parallel street for food which is much better than restaurants along La Rambla. Within 5mins walk to Port Vell. There are a couple of sundry shops that sells water, fruits and snacks next to the hotel. The area is quiet at night. There is a rooftop but can only see the view of other roofs.. The room is clean but the bathroom is open concept with only a curtain to cover. Toilet is separate from the bedroom and bathroom. The room is bright as the room has glass wall from floor to ceiling. You may feel uncomfortable taking shower in the beginning as if someone is looking from outside. The glass is tinted with paintings hence you can't really see from outside. Due to the design of the bath, the water from the shower kept flowing on the floor... Staff is friendly and wifi is free and available upon request for password from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Bleehk
Reviews.Content: I was only there for 1 night, I didnt expect much, so was happy with the Room, smaller than expected but good, some of the pictures on the website do mislead but thats with all hotels. Was happy with the staff, room and location. Good place if you are staying alone and short stay (1day max 2). Probably find better considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Zod7
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife to barcelona for three nights and I enjoyed the stay at this hotel very much. The room was clean, convenient and felt furturistic. It was very close to la rambla so it saved us a lot on travelling (previous visits involved hotels in the business district). It has 3 metro stations near-by and is very simple to get to from the airport. Only drawback is that the actual road it self is still developing and at late night it can feel intimidating if you are on your own. There were a few drug users and homeless people on the road. But we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good balance between price and standard”
Reviews.Author: KikiTallinn
Reviews.Content: The exterior resembling somehow a parking building and check-in area bit bare & basic, but you shouldn't let that put you off because - as it turned out later - it was still a good bargain! The room was basic, but spacious (the others seemed to be, too), quiet and even had a big double bed that wasnt made of 2 separate mattrasses like often DBL rooms in hotels. At breakfast there was lots to choose from and the space itself was also coolly decorated and spacious and had light flooding in. Staff was very attentive and friendly and the place was close to main points in the city (plus metro stattion Parallel), but the street itself and the bums sleeping in front of the house at nights was a downside. Keeping in mind that we paied only around €70 per night, it was a very good deal! I could easily dare to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, Great Staff, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: vicky e
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about the Hotel, I was slightly worried where we were going to end up, Yes the hotel is in a little bit of a run down area.. but isn't most of Barcelona! The hotel staff were very friendly, the room was very nice.. yes the style isn't to everyone's taste but our room was very spacious.. The only thing that lets it down is it has no window/ventilation. We had breakfast at the hotel which was very good, and after looking at the dinner menu and how busy it was we wish we had maybe had dinner in there too. If you want an ideal location just of the Rambla, good price, and nice hotel then this is ideal x

Reviews.Title: “Find Somewhere Else!!”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend recently returned from Barcelona after spending a very poor 3 nights at this hotel. We arrived and where shown to our first room which had a jail cell feel to it, with no windows and no internal structure seperating the bathroom from the bedroom. After showering, we discovered to our annoyance that the drain wasn't draining at a decent rate, and we where padding about in dirty bathwater. After getting our room changed and 'upgraded', we where put in a room that wasn't generally getting used by the hotel due to the very evident damp problem that the room had. Trying to start the air con to disperse the steam due to the lack of windows, we where told that they had recently got it switched to warm air only, and so had to open the room door to allow the steam to escape. If you are looking for a hotel with location only, then this is relatively good, but the lack of decent amenities and poor design of this hotel will have you gritting your teeth from the get-go!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, fab staff”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireBella
Reviews.Content: The Mimic is in a relatively run down area of Barcelona, but it is easy to get to the places you need to see. Although the rooms are small, ours was absolutely spotless and I am surprised to hear other reviewers saying different. The decor was different and imaginative, and added to the experience. Staff were welcoming and friendly, and the breakfast first class. We had a fabulous time in Barcelona and I would certainly stay here again. Thankyou staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and imaginatively designed hotel let down by serious hygiene issues”
Reviews.Author: Edward O
Reviews.Content: The Mimic is situated in a relatively run-down, mainly residential, inner city district to the west of La Rambla. Despite this, we found the location very convenient, within easy walking distance to the old port, Montjuic, metro stations and most of the attraction of Old Barcelona. Service at reception was pleasant and helpful, if understaffed (one receptionist only between 11am and 2pm which surely must be one of the busiest times in terms of arrivals and departures), resulting in quite long waits. The staff in the restaurant/bar/breakfast area were particularly pleasant and helpful. The hotel has clearly been built and furnished to a budget, with some unexpected finishes in places (concrete paving slabs in the lobby; IKEA furnishings in the restaurant and lounges) although the overall design is interesting and playful and hangs together quite well. Some customers might dislike the bathing arrangements, the shower being situated immediately against the external (floor to ceiling) window, which, despite partial frosting, did not provide privacy. The first major problems emerged in the bedroom (we were initially given keys to Room 119 on the first floor). Despite fresh bedding, the condition of the room was totally disgusting: fresh dirt on the floors; unclean toilet; scuffed and dirty walls; and an external window so filthy that you could barely see through it. This was not a room that one would feel at all comfortable walking barefoot in, and we rejected it straight away. We were (relatively quickly) provided with keys to another room on the 5th floor (507). This was much better and brighter, and appeared at least to have been cleaned at some point within recent weeks. The bed itself was very comfortable, and the room quiet and reasonably well ventilated. Breakfast was excellent. Good coffee, a wide array of cheeses and cold meats, and great hot selection. Looking back at the hygiene issue, part of the problem with the rooms in general was the floor finish: a white, marbled linoleum which scuffs and stains easily and which, without regular cleaning with bleach, can quickly look unpleasant. Unless management has understood this and commits to maintaining it properly, together with raising standards of cleanliness generally, this hotel, despite having much to recommend it in terms of location and convenience, is not up to European standards and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Alex F
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend away for a surprise weekend break in March 2011 and we stayed at Acta Mimic. When we got there the staff were wonderful and helped us with everything. The room we stayed in was on the first floor and was clean and very nice. The hotel is also perfectly placed to get around and see everywhere. Loved the break and if I'm returning to Barcelona I will return here!

Reviews.Title: “Acta Mimic Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Virginia G
Reviews.Content: We were just at the Acta Mimic hotel in Barcelona - 4 of us - and enjoyed our stay very much. We had read all the reviews and were apprehensive of the area and seeing into the bathroom. Could these people stayed at another hotel??? It was as safe as any hotel. We had no problems. It was close to the cruiseport. Very modern and the staff was very helpful. The breakfast area was nice and so was the breakfast. The area to the right of the hotel (Parallel street I think) was noisy and sleezy in parts. The other way to Las Ramblas was fine and we enjoyed sightseeing on the hop on and hop off bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_to_travel147
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona, spent three nights at the Acta Mimic and thought the hotel was fine. We were a bit wary after reading other reports but these turned out to be groundless. The area may be a little rundown but if you are sensible you will be fine. If you are returning from La Rambla and feel a bit apprehensive about walking down the dim narrow lane at night then go to the end of La Rambla and pick up Paral.lel as the hotel is situated at this end of Arc del Teatre. As for the hotel itself we thought it was of a good standard, the rooms were adequate and kept very clean. The black and white decor is a bit stark but added to the red corridor lighting makes for something a little different from the normal bland hotels. All things considered we thought this hotel a good choice and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Break”
Reviews.Author: Jenny1972
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just got back from a 3 day break in Barcelona. Had a great time in such a great City. Dont beleive all the reviews you read as long as you have your wits about you there is nothing to worry about. I found the whole experience an eye opener but in a good way and had a fab time. The hotel staff were very friendly the rooms were clean and tidy and the beds were made each day and clean towels were left. The only thing i will mention is that the beds do tend to move a bit and they could do with bolting down to the floor but thats about as much as i can say on that one :-) Overall fantastic time and would definatly return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous location watch you wallet!”
Reviews.Author: 1durlust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night before a cruise. As we were checking in, a local walked into the hotel lobby and stole a piece of my husband's. Lucking a man waiting to check in was able to run after the culprit and retrieve the bag. The lobby is small, no one is available to help with luggage. The rooms are very small, furnished with basics(1plastic chair and table) but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Charmaine R
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in June 2011. Our main reason for travelling to Barcelona was for an extended football trip. Therefore we wanted to be close to la rambla yet not too far from the football stadium, this hotel was ideal! and made even easier with the metro! We found the hotel staff extremely helpful, on one occasion me and my partner wanted to spend the afternoon at the beach yet didnt bring beach towels so the receptionist let us take our room towels! The rooms aren't massive but to be honest we only used them to shower and sleep in so suited us fine! The shower was AMAZING!! i have only have one gripe....the wall above the bed, which was white had dirty 'run' marks on, almost as if some one had wiped it with discoloured water and it had run. On one occasion we walked outside the hotel, we had literally taken 5 steps in the direction of la rambla when we witnessed a man trying to grab a ladies bag, he did it in a just passing bump into the side out you kind of way. She was obviously a local, kept hold of her bag but gave him some (what sounded like) abuse in spanish! and that was the end of that, However i dont think you can critise the hotel for this as i was warned before travelling that you have to be warey of 'pick pockets' Overall good hotel, good location...LOVED Barcelona!!! Definatly want to return to this part of the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: hp52
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Acta Mimic and after reading some previous comments felt I had to write to say how we enjoyed this hotel. Reception staff helpful, first impression of the room was wow so clean and this was kept up all the time we were there. Yes it is different but is that not the beauty of it to go to another city and live slightly different!! We didn't see any drug dealers - in the Ramblas we did see quite a few Police quietly walking and watching so felt safe. Barcelona we felt was a buzzy fresh and safe city and the Hotel Acta was like that - the staff are smiley friendly and couldn't be more helpful. We can't wait to come back and of course we will certainly stay at the Hotel Acta Mimic

Reviews.Title: “Claustraphobic”
Reviews.Author: SimonC21
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel 12/9/11. Good location, not far from Parallel Metro (short walk) and also near to Ramblas (20 minute walk). Front desk staff initially friendly. Lifts to all floors, not very responsive and have to wait some time. Left lift to be faced with completely black corridor to room lit only by small red lights set in walls. Corridor noisy all time with people coming and going. First impression, brothel. Entered room. First impression, tiny for two people and two cases, modern. Decorated white, walls badly marked from many previous occupants, looked clean. Wall window to outside, however, looked onto concrete wall ONLY. Great shower, large. Double bed, comfortable but the chambre maid needs lessons in making them. Great to see a duvet on the bed but when this was un-tucked from the bed ot also took the bottom sheet with it. Sink in room, free standing, no plug, badly corroded at it's base, no plug. Great mood lighting in room, worked first night only. Noisy Air Con. Safe popped open when locked. Large blackout curtain had to be pulled across room (almost halving it) at night. Never closed properly, bought tape to keep it shut in end. Outer building flood lit at night, lights eventually go off around midnight. Toilet, seperate from main room, also entirely black. Somebody flushed toilet in room above and could be heard in ours. Too much furniture in a small room. Could do with more shelving and less tables. Phone in room, what for? Not a single information sheet / book to say how to contact reception / room service / restaurant / another room / make an outside call. Breakfast room / restaurant GREAT, staff REALLY FRIENDLY, food good. Nice lounge area also (3 TVs in one lounge competing with one another). GREAT sun terrace. Went to reception and asked if we could changed to another room which had a view, told there weren't any (also heard others asking who got the same response). However, rooms at rear of hotel did have a view of surrponding apartments. Asked for safe to be fixed so it would stay shut. Asked again for safe to be fixed so it would stay shut, eventually happened. Asked for plug for sink, none in hotel. Asked for mood light to be fixed, asked again for mood light to be fixed, never happened. By this time the receptionist had become quite FROSTY. Hotel for single traveller perhaps on a short business trip ONLY. NOT GOOD as a base for the longer stay traveller to explore the city from. It was CLAUSTRAPHOBIC and DEPRESSING. Stayed away from it as long as possible so as little time was spent there as possible. CANNOT RECOMMEND OVERALL.

Reviews.Title: “location ideal, slightly over designed”
Reviews.Author: drilltime
Reviews.Content: the location is fantastic, in the heart of raval. the staff are attentive and polite. the great design is slightly flawed as minimalism tends to be very high maintainence and plain white and black show up dust and wear far more readily. that said, i have no genuine complaints. as for crime and vice, it's a cosmopolitan area of an ancient port city. if you want to live in a bubble central barcelona is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & unique atmosphere with very friendly guest service”
Reviews.Author: d_pecheur
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful staff & a very distinctive decor that makes the stay at this hotel very memorable and special. There's a very nice lounge on the bottom floor that provides a relaxing environment to unwind or socialize and it really made me feel at home there. My only complaint, which is a mild one, is that the configuration of the room itself was a little odd and took some getting used to. But I really enjoyed the room because it is so unique compared to anywhere else I've stayed. The hotel is artsy and avant-garde and gave its own rich color to my experience of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: visez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 20.07 till 25.07- the location is nice, it;s near to centre, port and the beach. It was very easy for orientation from the airport and Catalunya. Yeah, it;s danger a bit, but where isn't? If you get there by "Paral-lel"-it;s very short area with dark part... but I we were walking till midnight and after this got to the hotel so i can;t speak for another time ... The staff was really helpfull, rooms are interesting and modern yeah, but i didn't like at all beds- it was like in a hospital- with wheels and they were moving all the time- i wanted to be with my boyfriend in double room-i think it means to be together, in a bedroom. I'm not ; pretentious but it's important!!! Other think that i didn't like it was lack of window to open and fridge... But generally i liked it , the breakfast was also very nice. I'm glad for the cleaning and also good impression made me the service for keeping luggages- we had to leave in 12 the hotel but our flight was at 19.00 so it was very confortable to leave our things to the reception and to be confident that they're in safety. Thank you! Wish you succes and a lot of guests!

Reviews.Title: “Good And Clean”
Reviews.Author: Celticbhoys2
Reviews.Content: Stayed from July 6th to 10th 2011. First impressions of area are not good,reception area of hotel small, whoever put photo on website done a good job. Room small but clean and after you get used to glass walls etc. it is no problem. Rooms cleaned and fresh towels every day. Air conditioning very good. Not noisy for a city centre hotel.Staff very pleasent and helpful. Hotel very central to everything. Walked to and from hotel twice daily and never saw any of the drugs etc. mentioned in other reviews. For the money probably as good as value you will get in the fantastic city of Barcelona. Dont be put of by other reviews, this is a fine place to stay for your holiday and I would return again, next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Make your own mind up don't listen to all the bad stuff”
Reviews.Author: Lil144
Reviews.Content: Downtown area but felt safer than down town in my own country . Great location for tour bus short walk away, not far from port vell and shopping centre . Great breakfast and food. Room odd to start with glass walls but not see through! Only slight moan is wash hand basin is by shower but not in wc.no tea making or fridge but there is a hair dryer . Very modern black walls red lights. Great value , great hotel , great place . Hotel staff helpful and friendly , would go back

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - very, very dangerous neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DanielleJA
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 4 night stay in barcelona with a best friend. We are two single girls in our late twenties. The service was fine here, and the amenities were fantastic. However, this does not make up for the fact that the room was 8x10 feet wide, had no door to the shower, there was absolutely no ventilation or windows in the room at all. The hallways were black, absolutely no lights with a hue of red over the door numbers (sort of very red light district). You could hear absolutely everything going on in your neighbors' rooms and the worse part is that the hotel is in the most dangerous possible neighborhood in all of Barcelona. We left the hotel one night at around midnight to go to a bar and there were 2 kids literally in front of the hotel using intravenous drugs in the middle of the street. Really, do not stay here. It is awful.

Reviews.Title: “3 star, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: runie01
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend recently stayed here for four nights, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a very good location, only a couple of minutes walk from La Rambla, although a choice of route to get there is advised as walking down the alley ways gives great sights such as drug dealers, needles and prostitutes. The rooms are very small and basic and the hallways are painted black with small red lights in the walls making it look like a brothel but as i say, you get what you pay for. Overall we had a comfortable stay, the room was cleaned daily, you just have to watch where you walk(keep to main roads).

Reviews.Title: “Could be excellent...but has some secret flaws”
Reviews.Author: akostop
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near La Rambla street, but in a not-so-good neighborhood (although we didn't really feel in danger at any time). The hotel is very modern, with a minimalistic look. The breakfast was very good, almost excellent, and the staff very helpful and polite. One of the main problems with our stay were the lifts. During our 5-day stay, the main lift was broken. So we had to make do with the small one, that carries up to 4 persons. This, combined with the fact that the lift was kind of slow, resulted in us waiting for quite a few minutes to catch a lift. Probably, when the main lift is fixed, things will be much better, although there will still be a problem, since the lifts work completely independently, with different call buttons for each one, instead of being synchronized, to allow the empty one to come first. The other little problems with this hotel are in the room. First of all, the toilet is situated in a dedicated little space by the room door, while the sink is situated across the room, in the shower area. This might be a problem for some people. Another thing is that the external wall of the room is all-glass, with a part of it (the part near the shower) made of frozen glass. This allows light to fill the room very nicely, during the day; during the night however, with the lights on, someone from the outside (as we find out ourselves as we approached the hotel on the way back from a night-out), can see the figure of the (nude) person taking a bath, or drying his/her hair (since the glass wall near the hair dryer is normal, not frozen, glass. But the biggest problem of the room (and this happened every day to both us and to a friendly couple living in another room), is that there is not a window you can open to let the air circulate. Therefore, after having a hot bath, the room is filled with moisture. The room has ventilation; however, this did not prove to be adequate. After returning to the room, after several hours out, when we opened the door, we immediately felt the moisty and dense atmosphere in the room. Unfortunately, I would probably NOT recommend this hotel to someone, because of the problem with the air circulation in the room (since I think all the other problems are minor, and overturned by the good aspects of this hotel, like its polite staff, its nice design and its excellent breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Cannot really expect much more from a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: GibonFire
Reviews.Content: Does what it says on the tin...Its a 3 star and you get everything you expect from a 3 star really... Clean, central location, and a decent breakfast. Value for money, compared to other 3 -4 star hotels in the area. Just a 5 minute walk to the main Las Ramblas Avenue, and less than 10 Mins walk to the main attractions and the Port and beaches.

Reviews.Title: “As trying to hard to be minimalistic it is almost lethargic in its ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Huglum
Reviews.Content: I hope that in writing this review I can give a reasonable and independent perspective on this hotel and help others decide if this is the right hotel to choose from the many available in and around Barcelona. I stayed at this hotel from the 23rd April 2010 until the 27th April 2010 4 nights in total. As an overall general experience the hotel itself is fine and offers as it says a very minimalistic experience. The hotel location is good although our taxi driver did not know it and I had to direct him from the airport, but it is a reasonably new hotel and does not sit on one of the main boulevards. The location between La Rambla and Av Del Paralelo is very convenient with easy access to the Metro network via the L3 at the Drassanes station. Most touristic attractions are within walking distance. The reception area is small but continuously manned 24/7 and leads to two very small lifts that then take you to the accommodation floors and the bar lounge area located below the reception at -1 level. The front entrance is controlled by the reception staff through electronic door management allowing for a level of security to the building. The hotel security is however let down by access to the lounge and bar area being gained through a spiral staircase situated outside of the hotel that has no form of access control during normal bar hrs. This entrance is visible from the reception desk but the reception can be busy and access to the hotel could be gained easily. This coupled with the lifts not being room card operated means that potential intruders could access the accommodation levels within the hotel via accessing the lifts from the bar lounge level. The hotel itself could represent a high risk of rooms being broken into (Although I am not sure/unaware if this has happened). The rooms do however have a reasonably large electronic safe that will hold a 15.6” size laptop. The 2 lifts are very small and as previously mentioned and are not operated through key card control. The lifts although side by side in the reception area are not synchronised in any way and are operated separately through utilising separate calling buttons. This is not such an issue on the reception floors but does become and inconvenience on the accommodation floors where the same lifts open back to back. This results in in some lift chaos. The rooms at the hotel were clean and tidy and did receive a reasonable level of housekeeping service each day with a daily towel and bedding exchange. Due to the minimalistic design there is very limited storage in the rooms with a small railing being available with 6 hangers for clothes and a small shelve above it (This is the storage in total). There are no drawers in the Rooms with bedside tables literally being plastic tables with open legs. The toilet facility is separate the shower and washing area and is situated either side of the main accommodation area. The toilet room lacks a sink for washing hands and results in that you have to then open the door from the toilet facility room to then access the washing sink at the other side of the room. This is inconvenient and not a particularly a hygienic approach to hand washing. The shower area is separated from the sleeping area by a glass partition but does have a curtain to ensure a level of privacy if required. The shower itself is very good although it does flood into the wash-room area adjacent to it. There is good use of mirrors within the design of the shower room area. The shower room does sit next to the outside window which is full length glass which is frosted in areas to help maintain dignity where necessary. It does however allow you to see outside whilst showering and for a good level of light to enter the room. This may not be to everyone’s taste but I am convinced that it is not possible to see in from the outside even with internal lighting on. The only disappointment about this is that the hotel has no views to mention from the rooms. The Room I was based in was starting to look a little shabby in general and for a hotel that was only 10 months old was a disappointment. This is mainly the walls and flooring of the room which is generally associated with the a cheap internal fit out. It does not help that the walls are all white and easily retain and show marks etc. I have stayed in numerous minimalistic hotels which have been great but the rooms in this one did have a very, very cheap design feel to them. The walls are very thin and you can hear you neighbours showering and using the toilet facilities which is not good. The main disappointment however about the room was that there were no windows to open allowing for some quick fresh air circulation (Although I am sure the air change in the rooms are very well mechanically controlled). The hotel offers a laundry service which I must say was disappointing as it took three days for it to be picked up and laundered as the laundry is collected and managed off-site. The quality of the laundry when completed was good but was very frustrating due to it being some three days later than when required. The hotel lacks any atmosphere and although has a very chic and vibrant designed lounge and bar area if feels almost lethargic in its ambiance. The staff at the hotel were good and responsive and could not be faulted in anyway and went out there way to help where needed. I think the hotel would be better for a 1 or 2 night stop as it is which I must say is my own perspective as not comfortable enough for a longer stay. The Hotel lacks some usability thought and a higher level investment in the internal design process.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SophieAr
Reviews.Content: Good location, cool rooms (quite small), very clean, comfortable beds, nice staff, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quirky, modern, comfortable and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Patsydoody
Reviews.Content: I liked how it's not like your typical hotel with a generic feel and generic rooms, it's quirky and modern and that bit different. The room was slightly on the small side but big enough, the bed was so big and really comfortable! The chill out area in the basement was really comfortable, so too was the roof top solarium - great place to chill out in the sun in peace. Location wise, it's easy to find and walking distance to all the tourist places like La Rambla and the harbour etc. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: koullis67
Reviews.Content: design hotel in a perfect location for touring and shopping.very clean and the personel was very helpful.the only trouble that we had was with the fact that there was no fresh air in the room because there is no window and especially after the shower you could hardly breath and see

Reviews.Title: “2 nights on business trip...did what it said on the box...nearly!”
Reviews.Author: whodoumeflip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mimic for 2 nights on business trip to the MWC. In the pictures I saw it looked a cool minimalist hotel and it was...black walls & red lights in the halls, white walls etc in the rooms. Sadly my room on the ground floor was noisy with the doors to the stairs banging all night with loud voices both nights. Room was a good size, weirdly with a spiral staircase leading from the bathroom entrance up to the sleeping area...bed was big and v comfortable. Bar area in the basement was luvly with sofas, tv's and a great bar. Sadly on the second evening I fancied a quick meal & bed however I was told there was no food available as the kitchen was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, extra clean, modern and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cardani2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to subway, very clean and modern style with a bath and shower so many modern hotels leave the bath out now, nothing better than a bath after a long day of sightseeing. Good breakfast. Amazing value for money!!!! Really enjoyed my stay there and would use hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice One!”
Reviews.Author: KathyKitty
Reviews.Content: This is a great find in the old part of Barcelona that's walking distance from favorite spots like Las Ramblas, Monjuichs, Barceloneta (mmmm, paella), Borne, Raval etc. Lots of restaurants, bars and clubs in the area if that's your thing (if not, why are you here?). The hotel has a cool design and comfy bedrooms... we loved the lighting, dark halls/red lights (one of my favorite schemes) so had no complaints as my own home is minimalist and dark. Staff is great and super-helpful. Breakfast is great and fuels you for the day. There's a huge lounge where you can relax after a long day of walking/shopping, enjoy a drink and browse a book on the sofa as if you're at home.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel very convenient to the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: marcopolowow
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about it. Great service and the best value for your money in central Barcelona. Breakfast was yummy!

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly original style,”
Reviews.Author: s_0mar_
Reviews.Content: I have been to BCN several times, but I was new to this hotel. I have spent one night there, and surely I will return next time I visit Barcelona. Excellent value for **

Reviews.Title: “Creative hotel, exhibitionist palace...”
Reviews.Author: MP641
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous reviews, we were prepared for the worst. In the end all turned out quite ok. Some remarks: - Windows can't be opened, and the air conditioning does not work in this part of the year. So there was a shortage of oxygen especially in the night. - The black corridors with red lights made us think of the red light district. - The curtain is clearly in the wrong place, unless you're an exhibitionist. - The free Wi-Fi was slow and with a lot of errors. - The creditcard machine failed when checking out. Some positive remarks: - The room was not big, but big enough for two people. - I filled in a questionnaire about putting stock of food on the floor, like donuts and croissants, in open cardboard boxes. The next day the manager came to me and said he was really happy with the remark and placed the stock in another (clean) place. Great to see that questionnaires can lead to action! - Great breakfast floor (-1) with benches, books, tv screens

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. An oasis of calm in a hectic city.”
Reviews.Author: Travellin_Steve
Reviews.Content: On reading the reviews of the Mimic after booking a weeks stay there my wife and I were a little nervous about what we would find. We needn't have worried as the Mimic is practically perfect in every way. The glass walled room wasn't a problem as some had found. The dark corridors lit by red lights were easily negotiated and not a problem. Breakfast was typical of European hotels everywhere and perfectly adequate with service being friendly and prompt. The hotel decor was clean and minimalist and it made great use of every nook and cranny available. It is exactly as described on the hotel website. Exactly !! It might not be to everyones taste I must admit, but if the website description doesn't ring your bell, then DON'T stay there and complain about it afterwards.
